Calypsonet Terminal Calypso API - 1.2.0-SNAPSHOT
  • All Classes
 

Uses of Interface
org.calypsonet.terminal.calypso.transaction.SignatureComputationData

  • Packages that use SignatureComputationData 
    Package Description
    org.calypsonet.terminal.calypso.transaction
    Calypso card transaction API.

    • Uses of SignatureComputationData in org.calypsonet.terminal.calypso.transaction

      Methods in org.calypsonet.terminal.calypso.transaction that return SignatureComputationData 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      SignatureComputationData SignatureComputationData.disableBusyMode()
      Disables the "Busy" mode.
      SignatureComputationData SignatureComputationData.diversifyKeyWithSpecificValue​(byte[] diversifier)
      Requests to perform a key diversification with the provided diversifier before signing.
      SignatureComputationData SignatureComputationData.diversifyKeyWithTargetSerialNumber()
      Requests to perform a key diversification with the full serial number of the target card or SAM before signing.
      SignatureComputationData SignatureComputationData.enableSamTraceabilityMode​(int offset, boolean usePartialSamSerialNumber)
      Enables the "SAM traceability" mode to securely record in the data to sign the SAM serial number and the value of the counter associated with the signing key.
      SignatureComputationData SignatureComputationData.setData​(byte[] data, byte kif, byte kvc)
      Sets the data to be signed and the KIF/KVC of the key to be used for the signature computation.
      SignatureComputationData SignatureComputationData.setSignatureSize​(int size)
      Sets the expected size of the signature in bytes, which can be between 1 and 8 bytes (optional).
      Methods in org.calypsonet.terminal.calypso.transaction with parameters of type SignatureComputationData 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      T CommonTransactionManager.prepareComputeSignature​(SignatureComputationData data)
      Schedules the execution of a "PSO Compute Signature" SAM command.
